comments: umagesh1!

Capturing the integration logic on the consumer side after the initial discussion
- Toggle modal visibility based on a boolean state variable
- Call modal close / open methods when the state variable changes (through Observable)
- Update state variable to false when `closed` or `secondaryButtonClick` events are emitted

The logic above creates a infinite loop as below: User clicks close button > closed event is emitted > consumer updates state variable to false > consumer calls the modal close method > modus component emits the closed event again. 

I've asked the team to have prevention logic to avoid this loop. From our side, for both open and close methods we will if the modal is already is open or closed state before performing the action and emitting the event.

title: Table: Option to validate and pass error message for each table cell
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

- Introduce an event `cellInputValueChange` that fires on input value change as the user type. This will be useful for consumers who wants to implement custom validation
- Introduce an optional `errors` property that allows the consumer to pass the error message for each cell. 

```
interface TableCellErrors {
  [rowIdorIndex: number]: { // if id is present in row data, use that, otherwise use index
    [accessorKey: string]: string;
  };
}
```

**Acceptance criteria:**
- The component should emit cellInputValueChange event for every change in the input field 
- Updates to error object should be immediately reflected in the Table component
- Should set the cell error state even if the user changes focus - useful if the validation is done in the backend. 
- The documentation should include the possible options, and clearly describe how cellInputValueChange and cellValueChange differs.

### Motivation and context
Consumer side validation and custom error message is already possible in the input components, we are simply extending the behavior for table inline editing. As a next step, we should also consider validation inside the input components.

### Proposal

Introduce an optional 'position' property that allows the component to be positioned relative to the item it is wrapping. it should accept various positioning options such as top, bottom, left, right, and auto, similar to how tooltips are positioned.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- By default, the date picker position should be bottom to ensure backward compatibility.
- The component should reposition seamlessly during page or container scroll.

title: Table: Retain cell error state even if the focus is changed
description:
In current implementation, the cell error styling and message is only persisted when the cell is in edit mode. If the user clicks away or edits a different cell then the previous cell error border and message is removed. Ideally the error state of the cell should be retained until the user corrects the cell value. 

**Acceptance Criteria**
- No changes to the existing prop or events
- Table cell in error state should be identified using red border and a error message if the input is focused.
- Table cell in error state should only retain the red border if the focus is changed.

### Describe the issue

# DESCRIPTION
An issue with the File Dropzone element, specifically with the "accept-file-types" property. When a user drags files to upload their images and I have set accept-file-types=".jpg,.jpeg,.png", the user is still able to drag or select other types of files (.pdf, .docx, etc.). This causes the element to incorrectly count that a file has been uploaded. Additionally, if the "multiple" attribute is set to "false", even uploading a correct file type after "uploading"  an incorrect file type results in an error. Currently there is no logic in the onDrop handler to honor the setting.  So the drop zone accepts anything, while the file input only accepts the defined times. Moreover, this similar occurs when if a user chooses to "browse to upload", if the user decides to upload an incorrect file type then a similar error will occur.

An alternate solution could be to expose an isDateEnabled function, which the user can then pass in to handle their specific logic. This is how Ionic handles the same type of functionality: https://ionicframework.com/docs/api/datetime#advanced-date-constraints

### Motivation and context

We have a use case where the user has to select a date window to display machine data across. Machines however don't have data available every day; it would thus be useful to provide some visual affordance to guide the user towards picking days that actually do have data available, instead of picking dates and seeing an error message pop up.

Did you observe this issue on Storybook or on your own site? Reason i ask is that I know that Storybook has many of their own built-in keyboard shortcuts which make testing some Modus Web Components on storybook a little tricky.

Can you reproduce the issue on this simple HTML test page I created?
https://coliff.github.io/modus-web-components-example/#text-inputs

I wasn't able to reproduce it. If you can please can you record a video or let us know which words/characters you entered?

@natanbcpc is it possible to provide more context or sample code that reproduces the issue.  Typing c in the storybook is seemingly working 100% of the time during my testing.  A codepen or stackblitz would be great for reproducing.
Tried starting a new project to test it and not getting this bug, closing this for now. Thanks for looking into it!

Found out what was causing the issue: CX Support uses react-hotkeys-hook, which automatically ignores key events from inside inputs through this line: https://github.com/JohannesKlauss/react-hotkeys-hook/blob/main/src/validators.ts#L27

However, for the modus text input, the tagName is not `input`, but `modus-text-input`. Adding the prop `contentEditable` to the text input fixed the issue.

comments: anwishaZ!

Hi @anwishaZ- the style guide needs to be updated. Button groups aren't **just** for toggle groups, they can also be used for a group of related buttons but not necessarily toggleable.

I understand that you'd like an option pre-selected for the 'single-selection' option (https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-button-group--default#single-selection). I would suggest that this could be an option (opt-in), but not on by default. maybe something like:

```html
<modus-button-group selection-type="single">
  <modus-button selected>Button 1</modus-button>
  <modus-button>Button 2</modus-button>
  <modus-button>Button 3</modus-button>
</modus-button-group>
```

description:

### Describe the issue

After upgrading to @trimbleinc/modus-bootstrap@0.31.1 I encountered that the icons that are loaded through the modus-button are transparent.

![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/7c2d07c3-8a20-425b-89f6-551403c09390)


It looks like the import of the modus.min.css is now required to set the default colors, which wasn't the case in older versions.

My current workaround is to load the css from `@trimble-oss/modus-web-components/dist/modus-web-components/modus-web-components.css` manually.



### Reduced test cases

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a project without loading the modus-web-components.css
- Add: `<modus-button button-style="borderless" color="secondary" icon-only="pencil" />`
- The button is shown, but is fully transparent untill the user hovers over it.

**Example repo:**
The issue is reproducible in https://github.com/janwiebe-glasbergen/modus-button-bug

The main.component uses two modus components, modus-icon and modus-button.

If you run a `npm install` and `ng serve` in this repo you will see that the fill of the modus-button is set to transparent.

It will work fine when you do either one of these workarounds:
- Downgrade to 0.30.0 it is working fine.
- Extend the styles array in angular.json with:  `./node_modules/@trimble-oss/modus-web-components/dist/modus-web-components/modus-web-components.css`

description:

### Proposal

When focusing due to tabbing into the component, the options will not show by default. Setting show-items-on-focus to true will override this, and show the options in this case. This is the only affect show-items-on-focus has on the component.
When clicking to focus the component, the options will always show. There will be no way to disable this.
When focused and options not open, down arrow key press will open the options.
https://modus.ideas.aha.io/ideas/MOD-I-84

### Describe the issue

The Forced-Colors mode is an OS-setting within operating systems. There are a number of problems with out components with this setting enabled.

- Close button is barely visible in dark mode
- Dropdowm toggles not visible in light mode
- Progress bar not visible at all (light and dark mode)
- Radio buttons check status not visible at all (light and dark mode)
- Select icon not visible in dark mode
- Slider track not visible at all (light and dark mode)
- Spinner Animation not visible
- Switch status not visible
- Tooltip Arrow not visible

## Useful Links

- MDN: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/forced-colors
- Smashing Magazine article https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/03/windows-high-contrast-colors-mode-css-custom-properties/

title: Hot-reloading of CSS changes not working in Storybook
description:
Running `npm run start-storybook` from the `stencil-workspace` directory does not hot reload CSS changes making development much slower.

REF:
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/77087676/hot-reload-broken-with-stenciljs-and-storybook-7
- `https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/issues/22124`
comments: Update: found a fix by adding `buildDist: true,` to the stencil config, then run the stencil watch command in terminal then in a separate terminal run `run start-storybook`. Then whenever a CSS change is made it compiles the CSS and storybook reloads it automatically. I'll make a PR.

title: Autocomplete Behavior
description:
https://trimble-arch.aha.io/ideas/ideas/MOD-I-35

1.) New flavor of autocomplete that shows all items when opened (rather than only showing items based on user input). I believe this needs to be a flavor only for the use cases when the list within the autocomplete is way too long. a.) it would confuse the user why everything is showing without knowing any context, and b,) it could take forever to load a potenially irrelevant list. 

2.) Scroll the list to the selected item (to assure user of their selection): once the user selects something from the autocomplete list, and reopens the autocomplete, they should see their selection within the context of the list. The already selected item item shows with a checkmark on the right and is the second one from the bottom of the list. 


**This is going to be addressed in a separate issue:** 
3.) If this is a multliselect autocomplete: show chips ABOVE the input field (not inside). When chips are created, and the field is reopened, the first selection in alphabetical order should be visible as the second from the bottom (unless it's the first one in the list or the last one in the list). 

https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues/2446
comments: @cjwinsor or @enowak1031 when will this be approved for engineering?
@apaddock This is approved and ready to be worked on! I broke the story up to exclude #3 on the list. But you can break it up further, if need be.

From discussion:
user focuses on autocomplete input, list opens of available items
user starts typing, list filters 
user either chooses filtered item OR user backspaces and the list unfilters, showing full list when no characters are typed 
user focuses on autocomplete with selected item, full list opens again showing the selected item selected
The autocomplete clears when it loses focus if a value wasn't selected.
@apaddock Discussed with team, and these requirements are approved to be implemented.

title: Autocomplete: value of valueChange event is empty string "" even though there's some options selected
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Currently when some option is selected, both optionSelected and valueChange events are triggered. 
When some option is unselected using chips, only valueChange event is triggered. 
When the string in input area changes, only valueChange event is triggered in this case too.

Value of target/datail of event is "" after erasing the last letter in input, even though there's some options selected. 
Value of target/datail of event is "" after closing the last chip.

So now, we cannot differentiate if the last chip is closed or the last letter of string is erased from input, as both triggers same valueChange event, where eventIn.detail = "" in both cases.

Thus we either need another event for closing chips or value should NOT be "" if there's still some options selected.

```html
<modus-accordion>

  <modus-accordion-item header-text="Item 2" expand-button-type="circleArrow">

</modus-accordion>
```

to:

```html
<modus-accordion expand-button-type="circleArrow">

  <modus-accordion-item header-text="Item 2"> Content </modus-accordion-item>
```

### Describe the issue

I would like to propose some changes to the Select component's `placeholder` property and its behavior:

**Optional placeholder Implementation**:
The `placeholder` property should be entirely optional. In the absence of  `placeholder`, the Select component should not display any placeholder text. Instead, the "currently selected" value should appear blank, aligning with the behavior observed in other input elements, such as text inputs

**Behavior When placeholder Is Specified**:
When `placeholder` is provided, it should exclusively serve as the "currently selected" value when no actual selection has been made. Importantly, this placeholder should not be included among the dropdown list's selectable options

### Describe the issue

Accessibilty standards state that if something is visible it must be readable by the screen reader. 
Disabled buttons by default are hidden from screen readers. 

The solution for this is tricky but documented here: https://a11y-101.com/development/aria-disabled 

The solution should result in a button that is disabled (meaning it looks and acts disabled) BUT the screenreader still finds it and reads it as a button that is disabled.

title: Dropdown Component Encapsulation
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

I believe that the purpose of componentization is to encapsulate behavior of a group of elements together to perform a specific function. For example, the Table can combine an HTML table along with other modus components (such as pagination) to create a unified experience.

Dropdown I don't feel is this way as it relies on an extra button, passing the id between the dropdown and the button. I think the Dropdown component should already have a button embedded into it and expose the button label. Also using id's can lead to fragile component.

In addition, if `The dropdownList slot was built to work with the <modus-list> and <modus-list-item> elements.`, why not just make dropdown list items a formal component element as opposed to imposing requirements such as `The item size property should be set to 'condensed'.`?

Before:
```html
<modus-dropdown toggle-element-id="toggleElement">
  <modus-button id="toggleElement" slot="dropdownToggle" show-caret="true">Dropdown</modus-button>
  <modus-list slot="dropdownList">
    <modus-list-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 1</modus-list-item>
    <modus-list-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 2</modus-list-item>
    <modus-list-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 3</modus-list-item>
  </modus-list>
</modus-dropdown>
```

After:
```html
<modus-dropdown label="Dropdown">
  <modus-dropdown-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 1</modus-dropdown-item>
  <modus-dropdown-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 2</modus-dropdown-item>
  <modus-dropdown-item size="condensed" borderless>Item 3</modus-dropdown-item>
</modus-dropdown>
```

title: Button: Add `type` attribute
description:
We should add the `type` attribute to the button element. The default should be `type="button"`, but user can also choose "`button`", "`submit`" or "`reset`".

REF: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#type

It's good practise to always specify the type because the default type is `submit` (not `button` as one might expect).

REF: https://webhint.io/docs/user-guide/hints/hint-button-type/?source=devtools

title: Accessibility Audit 2024
description:
Fix all accessibility issues:

- Card
  - Cards have `role="article"` which [is not recommended](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/article_role) (and not always appropriate) (low priority)
- Checkbox
  - #2514
- Dropdown
  - #1194  (low priority)
- Navbar
  - #1628 
  - #2212 
- Pagination
  - Add `aria-label="Previous"` and `aria-label="Next"` to the SVG images within those buttons (Not on the list items themselves).
- Switch
  - Switch have invalid ARIA attribute value: `aria-checked=""` (Should have true or false)
  - Switch is missing `role="switch"` (not announced by screen readers)
- Tabs
  - Tabs should be buttons (not divs)
- Tooltip
  - #2177

title: Navbar: Make profile optional
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Add a `show-profile` property to the Navbar, defaulting to `true`. We've decided to default to `true` to avoid introducing a breaking change, while also maintaining consistency with the existing `show-` prefix nomenclature in our properties.

### Motivation and context

There are scenarios where providing the user the option to sign out is unfavorable.  In the known instances, the profile menu is not necessary.  The provided scenarios were:
1. Tekla Assistant window that is opening a website inside a desktop application, providing user details or sign out options does not make sense in this context
2. e-Builder popup windows - Signing out from a popup window does not make sense based on desired user flow. The user should not be able to navigate to another page via profile menu links that take them back to the full page experience inside a popup window.  User delegation feature allows for switching of user context which could create confusion as the main page wouldn't update to reflect immediately.


Although this leads to the ability to use the `buttons` prop to define your own avatar button, this is not a supported use case by the modus design system.  To comply with guidelines, if a profile and profile menu are needed then the built in profile should be used.

title: Table Sorting Improvements
description:
- Every table cell needs to be focusable so the screenreader can read the content

- When sorting is enabled within a column, the sort icon must be visible as default (not only on hover)

- The sort icon must have a tooltip

- User can sort by clicking on the header text OR on the sort icon. When sorted, the icon changes and the header text becomes bold. Clicking again reverses the sort order.

- User can click within the cell on empty space, the drag cursor (open hand) shows on hover and once clicked and dragged (cursor changes to closed hand) the column can be reordered. 

- When the user tabs into the column header, the screenreader reads the content of the cell. When the user presses enter, the column header is raised to indicate the user can reorder columns with left/right arrows. 

- When the user tabs again, the focus moves to the sort icon allowing the user to sort by pressing enter. 

**A-Ha! submission for reference:** https://modus.ideas.aha.io/ideas/MOD-I-15
comments: @cjwinsor Here's an issue for everything that's approved for the sorting functionality. Feel free to slice and dice it as you see fit.

@enowak1031 A point of clarification coming from the e-Builder team.  They are asking about having tooltips for:
1. Empty Header - To indicate drag and drop behavior
2. Text Header - To indicate sort
3. Sort Icon - To indicate sort (Already exists today)

What hasn't been mentioned is:
- If Reorder is not enabled, I don't expect a tooltip on an empty header
- If Sorting is not enabled, I don't expect a tooltip on the header text
- Do we have a tooltip on the cell that indicates drag and drop when there is a header and sort enabled (moving 1px away from header text or sort icon would switch between sort tooltip and drag and drop tooltip
- If sort is not enabled would we show a tooltip for drag and drop even when they are hovering over the header text
- Are these the correct tabbing orders:
    - Reorder & Sort Enabled: Cell > Header Text > Sort Icon
    - Only Reorder: Cell > Header Text
    - Only Sort: Header Text > Sort Icon
    - Or is it always Cell > Header Text > Sort Icon (if visible)
    
I am going to send a link to this comment to the e-Builder team as well.
Sort icon should be "active button" when sorted.  So it will have some background color to it.  Exact styling should be figured out.

Test scenarios as defined on the user story: https://e-builderinc.atlassian.net/browse/NAV-422

### Focus 

_**Preconditions: Sort enabled**_

Scenario 1: Validate that header texts are tab focusable when sort is enabled

Scenario 2: Validate that header texts are tab focusable after adding a new column when sort is enabled

Scenario 3: Validate that header texts are tab focusable after removing a column when sort is enabled

**_Preconditions: Sort disabled_**

Scenario 4: Validate that header texts are tab focusable when sort is disabled

Scenario 5: Validate that header texts are tab focusable after adding a new column when sort is disabled

Scenario 6: Validate that header texts are tab focusable after removing a column when sort is disabled

### Sorting

**_Preconditions: Sort enabled_**

Scenario 7: Validate that a column can be sorted ascending when clicking on the header text when the column has not been sorted via the header text

Scenario 8: Validate that a column can be sorted descending when clicking on the header text when the column has been sorted ascending via the header text

Scenario 9: Validate that a column can be return to unsorted when clicking on the header text when the column has been sorted descending via  the header text

Scenario 10: Validate that a column can be sorted ascending when clicking on the header text when the column has been returned to unsorted via the sort icon

Scenario 11: Validate that a column can be sorted descending when clicking on the header text when the column has been sorted ascending via the sort icon

Scenario 12: Validate that a column can be return to unsorted when clicking on the header text when the column has been sorted descending via the sort icon

### Tooltips:

**_Preconditions: Sort enabled_**

Scenario 13: validate that header text show the "Sort Ascending" tooltip on a column that have not been used for sorting

Scenario 14: validate that header text show the "Sorted Ascending" tooltip after clicking the header for sorting for the first time

Scenario 15: validate that header text show the "Sorted Descending" tooltip after clicking the header for sorting for the second time

Scenario 16: validate that header text show the "Sort Ascending" tooltip after clicking the header for sorting for the third time

Scenario 17: validate that only the sort icon tooltip appears when the header text is focused via tab and the sort icon is hovered using the mouse pointer

Scenario 18: validate that only the sort icon tooltip appears when the header text is focused via tab and the sort icon is hovered using the mouse pointer

Scenario 19: validate that only the header text tooltip appears when the sort icon is focused via tab and the header text is hovered using the mouse pointer

### Tab Order

Scenario 20: Validate tab order when Reorder and Sort are enabled
  1.- Header Cell
  2.- Header Text
  3.- Sort Icon
  4.- Cell border for cell resize
  5.- Back to step 1 but pointing to the next cell to the right, except if its the last column 

Scenario 21: Validate tab order when Reorder is enabled and Sort is disabled
  1.- Header Cell
  2.- Header Text
  4.- Cell border for cell resize
  5.- Back to step 1 but pointing to the next cell to the right, except if its the last column 

Scenario 22: Validate tab order when Reorder is disabled and Sort is enabled
1.- Header Text
2.- Sort Icon
4.- Cell border for cell resize
5.- Back to step 1 but pointing to the next cell to the right, except if its the last column 
Mouse Pointer

Scenario 23: Validate that the mouse pointer is a “pointing finger” when the mouse hovers over the header text

Scenario 24: Validate that the mouse pointer  is a “pointing finger” when the mouse hovers over the sort icon

Scenario 25: Validate that the mouse pointer  is a “grabby hand” when the mouse hovers over the cell (not the header text, not the sort icon, not the dividing line between cells)

title: [Modus-Table] Pagination is not working when enabled without refreshing

### Describe the issue

The pagination of the modus-table is not working correctly when it get's enabled after the page loaded. 
It looks like the 'showing result' and pages are rendered correctly, but the data in the table is never updated.

After a refresh of the web-page the pagination works like expected.

- Set the pageSizeList prop to `[2,3,5]`

 ![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/116563683/8a6573a5-ae15-4e75-9c41-c437de9521d3)

  - Switching the page view doesn't affect the result in the table

title: Date Picker - Available dates should dynamically update to reflect the latest changes without requiring a manual refresh.
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

**Bug Description:**
The Date Picker component in the Modus Web Components library presents an issue when modifying the minimum and maximum dates using the UI controls. Specifically, when selecting a date that falls below the minimum date or exceeds the maximum date, navigating to available dates in the calendar does not update to reflect the latest changes. A manual refresh of the URL is required to observe the correct behavior.

### Reduced test cases


**Expected Behavior:**
After modifying the minimum and maximum dates and selecting a date outside the valid range, navigating to available dates should dynamically update to reflect the latest changes without requiring a manual refresh.


**Technical Scenario:**

- Access the URL(https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-date-picker--default-with-picker).
- Observe the Date Picker component, focusing on the "default-with-picker" story.
- Modify the minimum date to "2022-12-02" and the maximum date to "2023-01-31" using the Date Picker component UI controls.
- Set the current date value to "2023-12-22."
- Select a date that falls below the minimum date or exceeds the maximum date (e.g., choose a date in December 2022).
- Click on the calendar and navigate to available dates.
- Observe that the calendar displays dates from December 2022, and all dates beyond this month are disabled.
- Manually refresh the URL and verify that the changes are correctly reflected in the calendar.

**Test Data:**

[Test URL](https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/story/user-inputs-date-picker--default-with-picker)
Existing Minimum Date: 2022-12-02
Existing Maximum Date: 2022-12-30
Current Date Value: 2022-12-22
Updated Maximum Date: 2023-01-31
Updated Current Date Value: 2023-12-22

title: Modal Accessibility Issues
description:
The Modal Component has a few accessibility issues:

- A closed/unopened Modal should not have `role="dialog"`, that should be added when modal is opened and removed when modal is closed.
- Modal should have `aria-modal="true"` when opened (removed when closed)
- Modal should not have `aria-label` when closed.
- Modal should have `aria-hidden="true"` when closed
- Right now, the `aria-label` has to manually set and is listed as 'optional'. I think it'd be better if the value of the modal title was used automatically. The title would have an id (e.g. `id="contactFormModalTitle"`, and the modal would then have something like `aria-labelledby="contactFormModalTitle"` then no need for aria-label to be used at all (this is what Bootstrap does)

title: Modus Icon: Event Name is `iconClick`, not `onClick` as shown in Storybook and clicking causes error
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Component creates `iconClick` event
```tsx
  @Event() iconClick?: EventEmitter;
```
But Storybook shows it has having an `onClick` event that is emitted
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/790dda79-14a1-4c09-a986-bdd381d0b20d)

And when the icon is clicked it produces an error
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'emit')
    at Object.onClick (25.cf0f1bcf.iframe.bundle.js:1:2565)
    at IconSun.Object.onClick (0.fb127b46.iframe.bundle.js:1:421530)
```

This is caused by the icons onClick being set as
```html
<IconMap ... onClick={this.onClick} ... />
```
when it should be this at minimum to maintain the `this` context.  
```html
<IconMap ... onClick={() => this.onClick()} ... />
```

Otherwise the context will be the icon from the icon map, not the modus-icon.

I am creating this ticket so I can work on it later.

### Reduced test cases

In Storybook for MWC, navigate to the Icon component and click on the icon. Observer the javascript error in the dev console.

title: Table: Add support for wrapping text
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

The table should allow for the text to wrap, instead of being truncated.  Since the current table is setup to truncate by default, we should leave that.  My suggestion is to add a `wrap-text` property that defaults to `false`.  When enabled, it will remove the css that currently causes the body text to be truncated with ellipsis.  I do not expect this setting to affect the header or the footer.

Additionally, padding needs to be maintained.  Currently, the `<tr>` has its height set relative to its `density`.  Each column type should ensure that it's effective padding is maintained between wrapping and non-wrapping configurations.

Currently looks like this:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/e82e1d1b-c11b-484c-9647-9bc3d435e6c6)

After changes, it could look like this:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/b7dd3400-ce8b-4b3d-a405-3d8c51eec5fd)


### Motivation and context

Currently columns are displayed which can show a large block of text.  Since this text is truncated, users cannot scan or otherwise search for a specific row based on the value of the cell.  By adding back text wrapping, the table can function the same as a standard table and gives us the control on whether its more valuable to have fixed and predictable row heights, or all the text in the cells being displayed with irregular row heights.

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

comments: cjwinsor!
Approved design submission to modus: https://modus.ideas.aha.io/ideas/MOD-I-19

Ewa has mentioned in the Aha that we expose a property to support wrap line to the table.
But I think the property should go to the column rather than the table itself. 
I am thinking exporting these properties to each columns

1. noWrap - Default false, when set to true the text goes to next line when the size goes beyond the width of the cell
2. maxHeight  - by default it will be set to 0. When a value is set (say for ex 50px), then the row can expand upto the set height
@cjwinsor and @rthanga1 can we please clarify if this is a table level setting or a column level setting?

> @cjwinsor and @rthanga1 can we please clarify if this is a table level setting or a column level setting?

Table Level
@cjwinsor Do you remember what we agreed on in terms of height? I mean, do we have to set a maxRowHeight to the table as well? Otherwise when wrapped, for longer texts, it can wrap to so many lines

> @cjwinsor Do you remember what we agreed on in terms of height? I mean, do we have to set a maxRowHeight to the table as well? Otherwise when wrapped, for longer texts, it can wrap to so many lines

**Chris's reply**
We don't set the height. We start with just letting it wrap. That's the minimum need. Once you introduce a fixed height, there is no telling if the exposed text has enough value to justify the wrapping or being cut off where it was.
Should still honor #1173

Questions from QA: 
What would be the behavior for the badges?

For column resize, if fullWidth is set to true, resizing one column could cause other columns to automatically adjust and their text to potentially wrap at the same time?

Is the expectation for checkboxes to stay centered vertically?

What should be the padding between wrapped lines?

Is the wrapping separating words between lines? or a word that would be broken move to the next line?

How is it expected to work for single words that are longer than the min width?

@cjwinsor the answers from UX are the following, can you please review?: 

> What would be the behavior for the badges?

Badges won’t wrap. They truncate in same line.

> For column resize, if fullWidth is set to true, resizing one column could cause other columns to automatically adjust and their text to potentially wrap at the same time?

No, changing one column shouldn’t change the adjacent columns. 

However, the right most column will take up the free space to fill the width of the table {as if it is floated right}. Refer the image below


> Is the expectation for checkboxes to stay centered?

Checkboxes are aligned vertically to the TOP.

The column should be non-resizable.

> What should be the padding between wrapped lines?

Is it padding or the line height?

It should be line height and match the line height as per the guidelines for regular text. [21 Line height]

> Is the wrapping separating words between lines? or a word that would be broken move to the next line?

Words don't break. They go to next line.

> How is it expected to work for single words that are longer than the min width?

The single words will sit in the first line and truncate just like tags.

Guidelines are updated in the Aha
https://modus.ideas.aha.io/ideas/MOD-I-19

> @cjwinsor the answers from UX are the following, can you please review?:
> 
> > What would be the behavior for the badges?
> 
> Badges won’t wrap. They truncate in same line.
> 
> > For column resize, if fullWidth is set to true, resizing one column could cause other columns to automatically adjust and their text to potentially wrap at the same time?
> 
> No, changing one column shouldn’t change the adjacent columns.
> 
> However, the right most column will take up the free space to fill the width of the table {as if it is floated right}. Refer the image below
> 
> > Is the expectation for checkboxes to stay centered?
> 
> Checkboxes are aligned vertically to the TOP.
> 
> The column should be non-resizable.
> 
> > What should be the padding between wrapped lines?
> 
> Is it padding or the line height?
> 
> It should be line height and match the line height as per the guidelines for regular text. [21 Line height]
> 
> > Is the wrapping separating words between lines? or a word that would be broken move to the next line?
> 
> Words don't break. They go to next line.
> 
> > How is it expected to work for single words that are longer than the min width?
> 
> The single words will sit in the first line and truncate just like tags.

This all seems good, but I don't know of a way in css that would accomplish the last part.  I don't know of both wrapping and truncating at the same time like that.

Overall, I am expecting the following styles unless testing files a better alternative or there is an issue found with this suggestion.
```css
  word-break: break-word;
  overflow-wrap: break-word;
```

And here is the relevant article: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_text/Wrapping_breaking_text

comments: yohernandez!
@cjwinsor To understand the requirement and the need

@Roliver-Javier @yohernandez Before I dive into this review I have a few questions:

 - What is the purpose of the `groupLeft` slot. What is the use case for its addition?
 - What is the intended goal of `groupRight` slot. What is the use case for this addition?
 
 I want to make sure we aren't over complicating without cause.

Hi @cjwinsor 

the purpose for each group is to have content in both sides, currently we only have room to place a label and that slot has an specific role for this. The group-left slot would be for components with its own role in order to not generate confusion with the screen reader if we use the label slot as a content on the left.

There's a label slot to the left already but for accessibility purposes if I use that slot and add another component
for example:
 a button. it will place a Role as a label instead of a role as a button and if I place a role in the button  component it will tab navigate twice (first the label slot container and then the Button component with the other role).

and that's why we have included the group-left where the responsability to place a correct role for tab navigation will be in the component that we're adding not the slot container

### Describe the issue

On a Mac or using WSL, running the commands
```
stylelint src/**/*.scss --fix
prettier --write storybook/stories/**/*.* src/**/*.* --config ../.prettierrc.json --ignore-path ../.prettierignore
```

will not run across all files. Mainly, `src/components` is not included.

By updating to use quotes
```
stylelint "src/**/*.scss" --fix
prettier --write "storybook/stories/**/*.*" "src/**/*.*" --config ../.prettierrc.json --ignore-path ../.prettierignore
```

At least per prettier [documentation](https://prettier.io/docs/en/cli.html): 
> Don’t forget the quotes around the globs! The quotes make sure that Prettier CLI expands the globs rather than your shell, which is important for cross-platform usage.

I'll make this update.

title: Default icon color inconsistencies
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

There are some inconsistencies in the default icon colors that have made it harder to keep behavior consistent across all icons.
The inconsistencies are:
1. Which elements the fill color property values are set on. Some set the fill on the `svg`, and others on the `path` elements.
2. Which colors are used as the default values for those properties. Some use `'currentColor'`, others use `#6A6976` or `#252a2e`

To resolve these issue and improve icon consistency, I suggest a few changes:
1. Use the `fill` property on the `svg` elements inside of the icon components, rather than the `path` elements
2. Default the `fill` property value to `'currentColor'` - which means that the fill color of that path will be the same as the color property of the element or its parent element (see example: https://jsfiddle.net/s4c1e2nu/1/)
3. Use a constant value for the icon default size of `16`

some rules/changes I have in mind:

- Remove `data-test-id` attribute on any SVGs
- SVG should have have `fill={props.color ?? 'currentColor'}`
- Remove any unnecessary groups `<g>`
- Maybe alphabetize the SVG attributes for consistency
- Set icon name as the class if no class name there already
- Remove any 'empty squares' (`<path d="M0,0H24V24H0Z" fill="none" />`)

I'm unsure about changing the default icon size to make them all 16x16 as it could have unintentional side effects if the icons are in use on sites.

title: Allow tabs to be set using slots
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

Currently using the tabs component is done so by providing an object list of the tabs to add. This poses an issue for us when supplying translation strings in angular, since the html template is responsible for translating; I imagine this is a more general issue with translations that isn't specific to angular.

I'm proposing altering the way tabs work to use slotted content for each tab (a good example of this can be found [here](https://shoelace.style/components/tab-group)). This makes it much easier for an implementer to use the tabs component.

Additionally, tab components tend to include slots for the content to display when each tab is active. This is less of a requirement and more of a nice to have if possible.

### Motivation and context

Providing component layout via an object rather that through slotted/projected content is not a developer friendly way of doing things. It also requires that the implementer looks after the state of the current active tab in order to render content relating to the tab. This is something the Modus component could do for us.

description:

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

Column reorder is not working properly when we drag and drop the column to an specific place,
it always go to the last column.

- when we're creating a table and set the column 
ex:
 `modusTable.columns = [ { id: 'first-name' } ];`

it's generating a dynamic ID to identify the table (in cases that we're creating more than one table)

this dynamic ID is going to be placed in the DOM element 

ex 
`<th id="asdfsd3er2ertgdfer_first-name">`

so when we're dragging and dropping, it's trying to find `first-name` but it can't find the element with the generated ID and that's why is putting the column at the end.

This changes is to update the `columns` and `columnReorder` in the tableOptions to set the properly ID and fix the reorder behavior

title: Document the different ways to subscribe to NPM releases
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

From @coliff,

- **RSS**: The https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/releases page has an RSS feed. If you use an RSS feed reader enter the URL and you'll get notified on each new release. I do this personally for some packages

- **GitHub Notifications**: There is a 'Watch' dropdown on the repo page https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components and you can choose to get notifications on new releases from there. You can set up notifications for these. I use the browser extension which works really well: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/notifier-for-github/lmjdlojahmbbcodnpecnjnmlddbkjhnn

- **Dependabot for GitHub**: If you use GitHub to host your code you can set up dependabot to automatically create a PR for new dependencies. It's very configurable - you can choose how often to check (daily, weekly or monthly). We use this on all the Modus projects and it can be integrated with CI/CD so you can get a deploy preview with each dependency update. https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuring-dependabot-version-updates

- **Node Check Updates**: You can add a script to your package.json and name it something like 'check-updates' and enter the script: npx npm-check-updates. It'll check for updates and report which ones are available. You can even configure it to automatically update dependencies if you want and exclude others. I use this regularly and recommend it. Read more about it at: https://www.npmjs.com/package/npm-check-updates

### Motivation and context

We can have this added to contributing file or the readme file or storybook page.

title: Modus-Modal | Tooltip for a disabled primary button
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

We should be able to give the reason why the primary button is disabled so that users can take action to enable the button.

The tooltip doesn't have to be visible when the button isn't disabled, I just need to be able to control it at the same time the button is disableddisable the button

Here's a link to the figma for the change, note the tool tip present above the button labeled "yes, update retainage"
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/109538462/95c080e6-24bb-44ec-8545-c472db51d32e)


### Motivation and context

We need to maintain a high level of accessibility in our product. If someone was using a screen reader to aid them in completing this work they may have trouble figuring out how to enable the button that is disabled.

Here are the design requirements written by UX for the ticket I'm working on. It should provide some specific implementation details and other guidelines and context
```
 Design


The accessible name of a tooltip can come from the contents, or from an aria-label or aria-labelledby.

position: top

text: “You must enter a percent to continue.”

aria-label: “You must enter a percent to continue.”

The tooltip should appear on focus or when the element is hovered on after a 2 second delay.

It displays and disappears via keyboard focus and removal of focus and by the mouse events - mousing over and mousing out.

The tooltip never receives focus. Focus stays on the owning element.
```

comments: @jliebma The Modus Approval Board has confirmed that it is not possible to have a tooltip on disabled elements and it cannot be focused on using the tab key. For your specific use case, you can either add an error message or make the input field required and disable the button until the user enters their input.

> The Modus Approval Board has confirmed that it is not possible to have a tooltip on disabled elements and it cannot be focused on using the tab key.

This is only true partially. It is correct that elements using the disabled attribute (e.g. `<button disabled />`) cannot be focused via keyboard. However, it is also possible to implement `disabled` with `aria-disabled="true"` and preventing the default behavior on click/keypress etc. This would keep the button as focusable, which in turn would allow using tooltips on such buttons. Has this alternative been considered?

```html
<button
  aria-disabled="true"
  onclick={(e) => e.preventDefault()}
>
```

Another usecase when the above approach would be preferred: when disabling the button when it is in a ["loading" state](https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/components-button--default#loading-button) (e.g. while a form is submitting). When the user has such submit button focused, then presses the button, then toggling `disabled` attribute will lose the focus (because disabled buttons cannot be focused). This kind of loss of context results in confused users and should be considered a bug.

P.S. I generally agree that marking the field as required, keeping the submit button enabled and showing errors on submit is a lot more clear solution for everyone, just that the technical reason for not allowing the requested usage is not 100% valid.
@mihkeleidast This is not a Modus approved pattern. Please, reach out to Randall Stillwell for a recommendation.
@jliebma do you have any questions?

@ElishaSamPeterPrabhu Updated Requirements:

* When `delay` is set to a number > 0
  * the toast will remove itself using `this.element.remove()`
  * the toast will emit its `dismissClick` event

comments:
When we create a child under a component which is a parent the new item comes under this
but when we create it along side a child it is another item under the same branch
Isn't this the expected way?
https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/122255626/dfb746c7-5448-4250-b2fa-f1c04bab45b5

Can we get a code snippet that adds the new item as a child instead of a sibling so we can verify how its currently working in this regard?  Possibly a code pen, but can just be pasted here as an example script.

@ElishaSamPeterPrabhu Based on your codepen, seems the defect is that we aren't handling the addition of children properly.  That would be what needs to be fixed to resolve this ticket.  If adding a child, it should end up in a state that matches how it would be if it was originally defined that way.

> @ElishaSamPeterPrabhu Based on your codepen, seems the defect is that we aren't handling the addition of children properly. That would be what needs to be fixed to resolve this ticket. If adding a child, it should end up in a state that matches how it would be if it was originally defined that way.

Yes, we don't support adding children to the items now.

To resolve, we need to handle a child being added to an item, and updating the parent correctly so they can expand/collapse.  
- Item has no children, child added, new parent now can expand/collapse
- Item has children, all children removed, parent no longer can expand/collapse
- Item has children, children added, parent is not affected.

### Proposal

Currently the ContentTreeItem component handles the ItemClick event. We'd also like similar event handling for cases involving Ctrl+Click and Shift+ArrowKeys or a single event handler for when the selection is changed.

### Motivation and context

In Creator we use the Content Tree to reflect the structure of the 3D object hiearachy in the in the viewer. Whenever we select an item in the ContentTree the same 3D object needs to be (de)selected. Single selection can be handled though the ItemClick event, but this does not handle cases where Ctrl+Click and Shift+ArrowKeys is used to select an item.

I think it would make sense for the web components's functionality and accesibility to resemble the React Bootstrap components since users might need to migrate from modus-react-bootstrap to modus-web-components as the bootstrap components are no longer maintained.

Modus React Bootstrap was created using an open source library, which means it has numerous features even if they may not be necessary. However, with Modus Web components, we adhere to the Modus Styleguide. If there is something that is not included in the styleguide, we need to have a use case to evaluate it from a UX perspective.

### Proposal

The state logic of `Modus Table` is managed with the help of [Tanstack](https://tanstack.com/table/v8). There is a known [issue ](https://github.com/TanStack/table/issues/4938) with row selection in Tanstack where if a table has double (or more) nesting, and a child is selected, its direct parent can use getIsSomeSelected() to toggle its indeterminate selection state. title: Issue with Manual Entry of Dates in Date Picker Field
description:

### Describe the issue

I'd like to bring attention to a specific issue related to manually entering dates in the date picker field, rather than selecting them from the calendar. In such cases, I've observed the following problems:

**Incorrect Handling of Invalid Dates:** When entering an invalid date like "31-09-2023," the calendar interprets it as "01-09-2023." This behaviour is inaccurate, and it would be more appropriate to implement validation that highlights or notifies users about such errors.

**Handling of Invalid Dates like 30-02-2023:** Similarly, when inputting an invalid date like "30-02-2023," the calendar interprets it as "02-03-2023." and it would be beneficial to implement validation that either highlights the error or prevents the entry of such invalid dates during manual input.

I believe addressing these issues would improve the accuracy and reliability of the date picker's manual input functionality. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

title: Select component using display as the component's value rather than the object passed in
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

The Select component should only use the `optionsDisplayProp` for displaying the text value in the select. Selection and the current value should depend on whatever object/value is currently selected:

```tsx
const options = [{ id: 0, display: 'Option1' }, { id: 1, display: 'Option2' }];
<Select options={options} value={options[0]} options-display-prop="display" />

// *click Option2*
// valueChange output:
// CURRENTLY: 'Option2'
// SHOULD: { id: 1, display: 'Option2' }
```

title: Modus Modal - backdrop (true, false, 'static') - not available
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

In the modus modal component a new property "backdrop" is required.
This would accept 3 values - true, false, "static"
When the backdrop is "static" - the modal does not close when we click outside the modal.
When the backdrop is false - the background of the modal is not an opaque screen, the background would be the same page, The modal would not also be closed once clicked outside the modal.
When the backdrop is true ( default mode ) - the backdrop is an opaque image, as usual and the modal would close once clicked outside the modal.

Below is the example for the expected way the backdrop="static" to work,
![backdrop-static](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/132334449/fa67d180-960e-41ce-b124-ad54944127cb)

Below is the example for the expected way the backdrop=false to work,
![backdrop-false](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/132334449/f1f34078-d59b-4c49-a626-3d3ec931c581)


Below is the example for the expected way the backdrop=true to work,
![backdrop-true](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/132334449/baf15faa-e3f0-4c4c-ab09-93ca800f1671)


### Motivation and context

We had a feature in our application where we make a background call on submitting the modal submit.
We then show the details from the response in the modal itself.
But while we progress the API-call in the background, if the user clicks anywhere outside the modal, the modal.close() is triggered and it gets closed.
Hence the process is interrupted.

> @ryan-henness-trimble is your team planning to work on this issue?

Our availability is low at the moment - we won't plan on taking this one on
@ryan-henness-trimble We are in the process of planning out when we'll tackle it 👍

Create a new property on the modus button which adds the press/hold/progress indicator as described for the critical action button.  Just like Danger and Special, we will call out this variant as Critical Action Button, which is specifically a Danger button with this property set to true. We won't implement this property if the color isn't set to danger.  That is something that can be added later if a strong need is brought up. We should make it clear in the writeup that this property only affects danger buttons.

The animation for the progress should reverse on mouse up at the same rate.  If they mouse up and back down before it resets to 0, pick up where they left off.

title: Automate `external-requests` tagging and `In Review` status
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [Modus style guidelines](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/introduction/)

### Proposal

When somebody from outside Modus submits a GitHub issue, it should be tagged `external-requests` and moved to `In Review` status.

### Motivation and context

_No response_

### What is the issue regarding ?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Medium

modus

modus

None

_No response_
comments:
how should we define 'somebody from outside Modus'? Who should be exempt from receiving the `external-requests` label?

We can setup the action something like this:

```yml
name: 'Issue Labeler'
on:
  issues:
    types: [opened, edited]
permissions:
  issues: write
  contents: read
jobs:
  triage:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: ${{ github.actor != 'username1' || github.actor != 'username2' }}
    steps:
      - uses: github/issue-labeler@v3.1
        with:
          configuration-path: .github/issue-labeler.yml
          enable-versioned-regex: 0
```

The Action will then only run if it doesn't match either username1 or username2

Then the issue-labeler.yml is

```yml
# Add 'external-request' label to any issue that gets opened by someone outside the organization
external-request:
  - '/.*/'
```

title: Create a MWC Update Guide
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Now that the library is mature enough to start introducing breaking changes, we should discuss how we want to help consumers update their usages when breaking changes occur

I see 3 options:
1. A markdown file called `UPDATE_GUIDE.md` at the repository root
2. A page in the Storybook site
3. An interactive site that let's the user pick which version they are starting with and which version they are updating to. That would then generate all the necessary steps they would take to update. This is a larger effort, and possibly overkill for the speed of development of this project

Either way, I think these options would all contain the same information: a descriptive list of what has been removed/deprecated and how to resolve issues that arise while updating from one version to the next

### Motivation and context

_No response_

### Which npm package?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Low

### What is the product name the feature is requested for?

Modus Web Components

### What is the team name the product belongs to?

Trimble

### What is the division name the team belongs to?

Modus
comments: Added the 'deprecation' label to support this effort

I'd vote for "2 - a page on the Storybook site". That way the link can be shared easily between colleagues.

Definitely not a fan of the idea of "3 - maintaining different versions", we want to encourage everyone to be on the latest version as much as possible.

I would also vote for 2 - a page on the Storybook site. Have seen a similar thing in other design systems https://react-bootstrap.github.io/migrating/#summary-of-breaking-changes-from-v1x, https://mui.com/material-ui/migration/v5-component-changes/, https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/blob/main/BREAKING.md#version-7x-accordion-group

> I'd vote for "2 - a page on the Storybook site". That way the link can be shared easily between colleagues.
> 
> Definitely not a fan of the idea of "3 - maintaining different versions", we want to encourage everyone to be on the latest version as much as possible.

I think I like 2 best, too

Just for future reference, this is the type of thing I was thinking for 3 - it could be more useful for teams who have fell behind quite a lot in versions https://update.angular.io/
Here's the draft PR: https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/pull/1355

I found my way here from #1283 

When upgrading Modus Web Components I found a breaking change. Given that we only incremented a patch semver version I would have expected this to be backwards compatible.

Could we use JSDoc comments to tell the user that the specific field is deprecated?

> Given that we only incremented a patch semver version I would have expected this to be backwards compatible.

As Modus Web Components is currently on v0.x there are still breaking changes from time to time which we make sure to call out in the Release Notes.

Once we release v1.0.0 there won't be any breaking changes without a major version number bump as we'll try and strictly follow SemVer.

It's a good point you raise though still, we perhaps should have at least bumped from v0.1 to v0.2 when introducing breaking changes are introduced.
@coliff @leohaughton @ryan-henness-trimble Maybe we can consider adding more details to the release notes. @ryan-henness-trimble are we still doing this?

@msankaran0712 That seems like a good idea, I think the main goal here is to have somewhere we can point consumers to when breaking changes have been introduced. It may be nice to add a section to the release notes that goes into more detail about what is breaking and how to resolve them

description:

### Describe the issue

Autocomplete - Controls - The behavior of Read-only functionality is not as expected

When the auto search field is set to Read-only, we expect the text field to be disabled where the user should not be able to enter any text in the text box and the field should only be focused when the user selects the text field.

Currently, the textbox is active and also user is able to type in search box. After entering the data user will have to give a space and "No results found" text is displayed as shown in the below screenshot:
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/129380495/5727fbfc-bce0-4922-a2fe-396b868655ca)

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Access the storybook
2. Select Autocomplete web component Default/With Option/With Custom Option
3. On the canvas section, under Controls set 'Read-only' status to 'True'
4. Place the cursor on the Search textbox
5. Enter the required data and give a space

**Expected Behavior:** When the auto search field is set Read only we expect the text field to be disabled where the user should not be able to enter any text in the text box and the field should only be focused when the user selects the text field.

**Current Behavior:** The textbox is active and also user is able to type in search box. After entering the data user will have to give a space and "No results found" text is displayed.

Toggle the product logo with a smaller icon variant at the `Small` breakpoint of 576px for responsiveness.

We do one of the following:
1. Add a property to `productLogoOptions` for `smallUrl` (or `iconUrl` though icon may be confusing).
2. Redefine the interface for `productLogoOptions` with a property for `logo` and one for `icon` which can each then have a `height` and `url` property.
3.  Rename `url` to `logoUrl` and add `iconUrl`.  We could have `url` as deprecated, and overridden with `logoUrl` to phase it in.

Then we would add `@media (min-width: 576px)` as needed to show one image or the other as is currently done with the bootstrap implementation.

Example change
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/bc4d0d37-d9cb-42ff-8e3f-8b3758719610)
![image](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/1130129/481e6245-51a7-48d1-bf3b-6cfde61a7c2f)

This is small portion of #89, creating a new issue as we wish to split up that effort.

It is e-Builder's intent to work on this request.

### Motivation and context

Implement missing aspect of modus spec per our UX direction.

### Which npm package?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

Medium

e-Builder

e-Builder

e-Builder
comments:
heya - I wasn't tagged in this, but giving my opinion on it since the responsiveness is related to Modus Bootstrap.
- I recommend that the responsive breakpoint should definitely be available at 576px. This is already the smallest breakpoint in Modus Bootstrap.
- 320px width is **tiny** by todays standards, even the smallest iPhone sold today (iPhone SE 3rd Gen) has 750px width.
- A menu icon, full product logo, and kebab and avatar would not fit on a screen width of 370px which the above screenshot suggests.

@msankaran0712 @soniakaukonen  to add an issue for styleguide and figma. 
Let the product choose whether to hide the logo or not for 576px

@coliff @msankaran0712 I will admit that we picked the 576 breakpoint due to how it was configured in modus bootstrap and neglected to double check the design system specifications.  We do not have a hard requirement that its specifically 576.

# NavBar - Add Button Proposal ## Requirements - An Add button added to `NavBar` to support e-Builder’s Quick Add functionality - Add button, when clicked, can show content provided through the implementation This is one of 2 or 3 icons that the e-Builder product is looking to add. ## Original Implementation The original design added the `Add` icon using the same pattern as the other icons. A `show-add` prop was added to the `ModusNavbar` component along with an accompanying `addMenuOpen` event. It was requested that an alternative approach be created to better support product specific use cases. ## Alternative Suggestion A collection is provided that defines icons to insert into the `NavBar`. The following schema is suggested: ``` // An array of items with this definition at minimum { id: string; label string; icon: string; } ``` A label property for tooltips (another issue we are working on), can be omitted until that work is done. An icon property can function like the `SideNav` items that accepts either a built-in icon or an image url. For slots, we can either request the use of `
` or request the slot name be provided. A generic wrapper component can be created to wrap a ``. This could also replace the existing notifications menu component. And finally, something like `navItemClick` or `navItemOpen` event. ## Considerations 1. Should there be a limit to the number of icons? e-Builder will need potentially 3 icons (Add, Reports, Accessibility... not sure if finalized). If considered, can limiting the amount be considered outside the scope of this work? 2. Do we only one to support built in icons, so nothing crazy gets added to the `NavBar`, or is that too restrictive? 3. Should there be more control on placement? We are looking to have these icons after the `search` icon. Modus guidelines do state "...any additional buttons should be placed in-between Search and Notifications" 4. Would there be any desire to have some or all of the existing icons (except profile) use this mechanism? Such as the pendo placeholder, which is outside the current default specification for modus as well. If considered, can this be outside the scope of this work?

cc @coliff @ryan-henness-trimble 
hey @cjwinsor I love the idea of passing an array for navbar icons. 

1. Anything in the below-highlighted group is optional and any product can choose to add or change the order of the elements. The array configuration will be really useful and it can prevent adding separate configurations for tooltips.
My only concern is the existing icons notifications and help, also are optional and I would recommend those to be part of the array too.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50131391/236254609-bca8e993-c43a-45c8-a436-8eba6ae99e48.png)


2.  I think it is okay to not limit the icons at the moment and it's better to accept both the icon name and the icon URL because the existing Modus icons set(https://modus-icons.trimble.com/) is huge and I don't know whether all those icons will be made available inside web components.

3. I talked to @egunther39  about the placements and you are right about the search icon. Where did you find the text  "...any additional buttons should be placed in-between Search and Notifications"  ?

@msankaran0712 That line about placement was on the [Design System Page](https://modus.trimble.com/components/web/navbars/styles/#specifications).  

I later saw that the responsive design details indicates the expectation for collapsing the icons, so in theory the count shouldn't matter as long as we implement some collapsing ability when responsiveness is added.

Notifications, Help, and maybe even the pendo placeholder, could be handled in the array.  That could be additional scope later as a planned deprecation, or we could remove them as a breaking change as part of this work.

Any thoughts or suggestions on the name of the array?  

Let me know when we are good to start on this change and we'll get it going asap.

The Pendo placeholder is good to remove 👍 

I like the alternative of passing in the icons as a collection. Here are some schema considerations I thought of:
```js
{
  id: string;
  tooltip: string; // Renamed 'label'
  icon: string;
  type: 'solid' | 'outline' | 'transportation'; // Not sure if this would be needed
  orderIndex: number; // Details the position of the icon (so that it is more explicit than array order)
  priority: number; // Details the priority level for responsive collapsing
  menu?: 'pop-out' | 'left-side-bar' | 'right-side-bar' | undefined; // The menu type (if left null/undefined, no menu is provided)
  disabled: boolean; // Whether the icon is disabled
}
```

Regarding
> I think it is okay to not limit the icons at the moment and it's better to accept both the icon name and the icon URL because the existing Modus icons set (https://modus-icons.trimble.com/) is huge and I don't know whether all those icons will be made available inside web components.

As a consumer, I would expect all of the Modus icons to be available through this dynamic collection passed into the navbar. We should consider adding an issue to get the icons added to the `IconMap`, or possibly consume the `@trimble-oss/modus-icons` package. Consuming the icons package seems like it would be much cleaner
@cjwinsor Closing the issue as we have merged the PR

title: Generate html.customData JSON file for VS Code autocomplete
description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

Stencil supports outputting the components as a `vscode-data.json` file which can be used in VS Code to autocomplete all the Modus Web Component element names and properties.
https://stenciljs.com/docs/docs-vscode

It's an awesome feature and will give developers a big productivity boost as it includes documentation (on hover). The popular Shoelace Web Component library includes it in their npm package so all developers can add it to their `.vscode/settings.json`.
https://shoelace.style/getting-started/usage?id=code-completion

It should be quite easy for us to add this by adding the output option to `stencil.config.ts` and making sure the generated JSON is included in the npm package. Then we just need to update the README and website to let people know.

### Motivation and context

This will be a great productivity boost for developers using VS Code... and the file will automatically update with each release.

### Which npm package?

@trimble-oss/modus-web-components

### Priority

Medium

### What is the product name the feature is requested for?

Modus

### What is the team name the product belongs to?

Modus

### What is the division name the team belongs to?

Modus
comments:
I got this working by adding:

```ts
    {
      type: 'docs-vscode',
      file: 'vscode.html-custom-data.json',
    },
```

to the stencil config. and then adding `vscode.html-custom-data.json` to `package.json` in files field so it gets included in the npm package.

title: [BUG] Color Scheme is always on light mode
description:
**Describe the bug**

Noticed a bug on [modus-web-components.trimble.com](https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/introduction-getting-started--page). The [color-scheme CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color-scheme) is always on lightmode. it's not a major problem, it just means some OS level controls like the scrollbar and autocomplete input form fields are always light.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to 'https://modus-web-components.trimble.com/?path=/docs/introduction-getting-started--page' when browser set to dark mode

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1212885/231117981-c6ec7b1c-d6bf-4296-b3d2-e24f22ae3b29.png)

I think we need something like:

```css
body.dark {
  color-scheme: dark;
}
```
comments: @coliff do we need this issue?

Yes we do. The issue still persists, but I just checked and the fix is super-easy so I'll make a PR. We just need to add `<style>body.dark {color-scheme: dark;}</style>` in the head. (the theme toggle adds the dark class to the body tag so the above CSS will fix the issue I think!

[BUG] Modal Component closes on dragging off the modal
description:
**Describe the bug**
The modal component will close itself if the user starts a click on the modal body, then releases the click off of the modal body anywhere in the gray overlay area.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Open the modal component
2. Hold the mouse down with the mouse over the modal body
3. Move the mouse off the modal body and over the gray overlay area
4. Release the mouse button on the gray area
5. See that the modal closes

**Expected behavior**
It seems like the modal shouldn't close if a click starts on the modal body, or if the user is dragging on the modal body and releases their drag off the modal body.
comments:
@cole-french-trimble can you please attach some screenshots to present the use case?

@egunther39 @soniakaukonen @enowak1031 @coliff 
looks like we need to decide if drag and drop operation from a modal is a valid use case.
Here's a video of the specific issue we're encountering. We have a text input inside the modus modal. When a user holds the mouse down in the text input and drags out of the modal body (to select the text in this case), then releases the mouse outside the modal body, it closes the modal.

Our current work-around is to be more precise when selecting the text, but we believe the most natural way a user would select the text would involve starting on the modal and moving the mouse off of it. All we need is a way to keep the modal open if the mouse click starts on the modal then releases off of the modal.

https://github.com/trimble-oss/modus-web-components/assets/97758471/fa62090c-6432-44d2-906c-0dd9a5b5e6f7

title: Set up a Development Website which auto-builds deploys from `main`?
description:
On the new [Modus Icons website](http://modus-icons.trimble.com/) we have it setup to deploy to production on each new release.

We also have [a completely separate Azure SWA site](https://ambitious-sky-021d71010.2.azurestaticapps.net/) setup which does deploy previews and auto-builds from the main branch. It was straight-forward to setup and is good because it means recently added icons don't show on the production site until a release has shipped (which may only be once a month).

Do you think it might be useful for a similar setup for Modus Web Components? Maybe, as releases are made very frequently it may not be needed? What do you think?
comments:
> On the new [Modus Icons website](http://modus-icons.trimble.com/) we have it setup to deploy to production on each new release.
> 
> We also have [a completely separate Azure SWA site](https://ambitious-sky-021d71010.2.azurestaticapps.net/) setup which does deploy previews and auto-builds from the main branch. It was straight-forward to setup and is good because it means recently added icons don't show on the production site until a release has shipped (which may only be once a month).
> 
> Do you think it might be useful for a similar setup for Modus Web Components? Maybe, as releases are made very frequently it may not be needed? What do you think?

Yes, I agree with the point that is not needed because we do releases frequently maybe we can revisit it when the frequency is less. @ryan-henness-trimble
@coliff can we consider having a `develop` branch and push the PR changes to that branch and use `main`  branch only for production release.

I'm not in favour of that really. If we did that it would mean that we wouldn't have a site built from the develop branch (which could be annoying in some circumstances if you're making a PR to fix or improve a recently merged PR which isn't yet live) and just means an extra complication at release time. 

I think the original idea of using a separate Azure SWA for main would be a better option, and then the (current) production site only gets updated when a release is made (not on every merged PR).

We will use https://moduswebcomponents.netlify.app/ for the dev site (always has all changes from 'main' branch.

Modus Web Components (hosted on Azure SWA) will only update when a new version is published. I just have a small adjustment to make for the GitHub Action for that.
